item.title: iSDA's Chief Scientist Dr. Keith Shepherd Wins 2025 IFA Norman Borlaug Plant Nutrition Award
item.description:
Rabat, Morocco – November 19, 2025 – iSDA is proud to announce that Dr. Keith Shepherd, Chief Scientist, has been awarded the 2025 IFA Norman Borlaug Plant Nutrition Award. The award was presented yesterday during the IFA Strategic Forum in Rabat, Morocco, recognizing Dr. Shepherd’s contributions to plant nutrition research and sustainable agricultural development across Africa.

A Testament to Scientific Excellence and Real-World Impact

Dr. Shepherd was selected by the Scientific Panel on Responsible Plant Nutrition (SPRPN). The panel was particularly impressed by the clarity of achievements from his research, which spans from significant scientific innovation to large-scale, tangible impact on the ground, delivering solutions that directly benefit smallholder farmers across the African continent.

item.title: iSDA at COP30: Bringing Africa's Climate-Ready Farmers to the Global Stage
item.description:
Belém, Brazil | November 12-14, 2025

For the first time in our history, Innovative Solutions for Decision Agriculture (iSDA) took our place at COP30, the world’s most important climate conference. As delegates from nearly 200 countries gathered in Belém, Brazil, at the very edge of the Amazon rainforest, we delivered a powerful message: building climate resilience for Africa’s smallholder farmers isn’t a future promise. It needs to happen now, at scale.

item.title: 2024 in Review: Celebrating a Year of Milestones and Impact
item.description:
As 2024 comes to an end, our team at iSDA are proud to look back on a year marked by progress, innovation, and meaningful impact. This year has been a significant step forward in our mission to transform smallholder farming across Africa through our Virtual Agronomist AI advisory service, empowering farmers with tailored, data-driven solutions.

From expanding our reach to enhancing the accuracy of our AI-driven advice, we have seen firsthand how Virtual Agronomist can support sustainable farming practices, improve yields, and unlock potential for communities that rely on agriculture.

item.title: Virtual Agronomist at the CPCN Seminar: Revolutionising Agronomic Advice for Farmers Across Africa
item.description:
In a world where smallholder farmers face increasing challenges in achieving sustainable productivity, technology has emerged as a powerful ally. At the recent CPCN seminar, our innovative Virtual Agronomist AI advisory service took center stage. This cutting-edge tool delivers personalised agronomic advice directly to farmers via WhatsApp, bridging the gap between scientific insights and on-the-ground farming practices.

The Consortium for Precision Crop Nutrition (CPCN) seminar is coordinated by Dr Canon Engoke, Senior Scientist at the African Plant Nutrition Institute based in Nairobi, Kenya. The CPCN serves as a dynamic platform where companies, research institutes, universities, NGOs, and national programs collaborate to share expertise and data. It fosters the co-creation of aligned crop nutrition principles, standards, algorithms, and other vital resources. The seminar provides a hub for innovation, aiming to accelerate the development of effective, evidence-based digital crop nutrition advisory solutions.

item.title: Showcasing Virtual Agronomist at the 3rd African Conference on Precision Agriculture
item.description:
We were thrilled to make a significant impact at the 3rd African Conference of Precision Agriculture (AfCPA), held in Marrakech, Morocco, from December 3rd to 5th, 2024. Representing iSDA, our Southern Africa agronomist, Paul Zauzau Chunga, delivered a presentation to showcase our Virtual Agronomist AI advisory service.

 

Highlighting the Power of the Virtual Agronomist

 

Paul’s presentation showcased the remarkable achievements of our Virtual Agronomist service, with a focus on its deployment for four key crops: sunflower and lowland rice in Tanzania, maize in Côte d’Ivoire and Uganda, and sorghum in Uganda. item.title: The Nairobi Declaration 2024: Results from the Africa Fertilizer and Soil Health Summit
item.description:
From the 7th to the 9th of May 2024, the Africa Fertilizer and Soil Health Summit took place in Nairobi, Kenya. The summit brought together relevant key players in the agricultural industry to establish new policies and investments that will improve soil health and increase yield responses for farmers across Africa.

Bruce Kisitu, our director of operations at iSDA, was engaging and collaborating with government officials and industry stakeholders at AFSHS 2024, to encourage transformative change in the African agricultural sector. He brought awareness to iSDAsoil, our open access soil health data map, and encouraged a continent-wide collaboration on soil data collection.

item.title: iSDA exhibiting at AGRF Summit, Kigali
item.description:
Grow. Nourish. Reward - Bold Actions for Resilient Food Systems

AGRF, Africa’s premier forum for driving the food and agriculture agenda in the continent, will host its 12th annual summit under the theme Grow. Nourish. Reward – Bold Actions for Resilient Food Systems from September 5-9, 2022 in Kigali, Rwanda.

We’ll be attending and exhibiting our products:

Virtual Agronomist

Directly supporting the aims of the summit is Virtual Agronomist, our system for expert advisory for farmers at scale, which supports resilient food systems by improving smallholder farmer yields and incomes, and by reducing waste through individualised fertiliser plans.
